The plant is primarily found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, and it plays a minor but ecologically significant role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, Lychnophorella regis is considered a vulnerable species in the wild.
